text:
Maybe I missed that. In Jim's original pic, I only see two pics in his original
post to this group. One for Win11(Disk 1 obviously Disk 0 not being shown), and
one for Win10(Disk 0). - I was commenting on Win10. Note: He did later verify
the device had another SSD, and it is possible that Windows created a Recovery
on that disk - Or since it came from another[different] device, it had a
Recovery partition that was in use on that different device, but still present -
while possible, it is also possible that second SSD was wiped to bare metal
before or after being added to the Win10 device. ..w

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Feedback to Microsoft
